reviews.review_msg: One of the most caring professors ever. Very passionate. Cool lectures and very accessible outside class. I would say make sure to attend, otherwise kinda hard to catch up since the course does not mirror the textbook, which is pretty much only for quizzes and general info. Course is generally chill, but not unreasonably easy, so pay some attention

First semester with her and I quite like her lecturing style and the breakdown of assignments. Decent quizzes based on the textbook and sometimes additional reading(s) which occasionally seemed like a lot but were still very doable with or without taking notes. She's generally engaging which is nice and brought us cookies on the last lecture!

Had a breakdown after 10 students AI-generated an essay, and completely reorganized the course grading system, made all assignments significantly harder and made all at-home assignments mandatory to be completed in-class. Do not take if you do not LOVE writing essays in-class.

RP is amazing. While she does rely heavily on France impact on classes that are supposed to be about Europe as a whole, she provides a good overview of the topics. Her focus on daily life and cultural trends gives a fresh take on historical events that is a nice change from most teachers. Easily the best History proff I have had.

Hist417 class was probably one of the best courses of my history undergrad. She genuinely put in so much effort to make an intersession course interesting and manageable. There are lots of weekly discussions and reflections that make it mandatory to keep up with the readings/videos/podcasts but she's flexible on deadlines, especially with COVID.

One of the best professors I have ever had at SFU. Roxanne is super caring and understands (possible) life struggles of students. The way she structured HIST 417 was a combination of readings, film watching, and podcast listening which was awesome compared to most courses which are just focussed on very dry and heavy reading. 10/10 would take again

Dr. Panchasi is a very casual and down to Earth prof. Her ability to account for the needs of students (even outside of the Covid crisis) is a blessing to say the least. She always puts in a lot of effort to make her lectures and assignments creative and interesting. A lenient grader, its hard to do bad in her courses. Highly recommended to take
She was a really engaging lecturer. Make sure you show up for class and participate! Hard marker, and she doesn't do tests, so you need to be a good writer to do well.
Worst.

Lots of writing, quiz every class RIGHT at the start so not allowed to come late, lots of reading (80 pages min each class) that the quizzes are on, sometimes 300 pages of reading, lectures are boring -captive audience-. She's super passionate but talks like a machine gun so you lose interest. Basically the class was just too much work.

She makes you work hard for your grade, but she is a great teacher! She is very knowledgeable and you can tell how much work goes into her lectures. She is more than willing to help people who ask, don't know why I stayed intimidated for so long. I ended up doing well and am glad I took the course. Learned a lot.

Roxanne is by far the best hist professor I have ever or will ever have at SFU. She was so interested in the subject and put so much of herself into the class. The final essay was completely reasonable and she was more than glad to help. I will go out of my way to take a class with her again.

This class was great! The quizzes were quite difficult at times as they were based on specific information from the textbook, but they weren't worth much. Paper topics were very fair and straightforward. I would recommend going to her office hours as she gives you extra feedback and clarification on how to improve your essays.

Roxanne is amazing! I highly recommend her! She is genuinely passionate about history and very charismatic/funny. She is also a kind person and thinks about her students. For example, she let us redo a quiz because the class average was low. She also would extend deadlines.

Lots of work (surprised it wasn't a W designated course!) but Roxanne is a very good teacher. She demands a lot from her students but is by no means unreasonable. Lectures were interactive and enjoyable, she wants to help her students succeed. Would absolutely recommend taking classes with her after a nightmare history class with Pabel.
Nicest professor ever. Good teacher (can be a bit dry sometimes) and not to difficult. Favorite history professor so far!

Interesting lectures, boring textbook, disfunctional tutorials, and surprisingly little writing for a W class. As long as you show up and put in some effort you should do well. It's a class well-worth taking and although it probably won't be your favorite ever, it also won't be your least favorite. Also, super nice prof who is willing to laugh.

Her lectures are interesting but they don't have anything to do with what we read in the textbook. I really don't like the textbook she decided to use this semester. It's incredibly wordy, political and BORING! She gives weekly quizzes on the chapter we're to read for that week and sometimes the quizzes are super hard! Over all this class is ok.
This was the best class I've had so far at SFU. Go to her office hours, they help a lot. She was a very cool prof who cared about her students. Work hard, get a good grade.

Roxanne was a fabulous instructor! Super energetic about the course content and always willing to take questions from students. Very willing to help students in her office hours. Assignments were fair and allowed for students to improve their writing skills. Enjoyed the selection of readings and films we watched in class.

It can be a bit confusing as to what Roxanne expects when doing assignments. Since this course more looks at approaches and methods as oppose to the history itself, it is hard to sift through the historical events and come up with a historical approach. Not your typical history course, though she touches on many different facets of history.

Doctor Panchasi makes learning a wonderful experience. She is an incredibly lively, knowledgeable, fun, gorgeous person and exceptionally articulate orator. I am far from doing great in this class but I would definitely take another class with her.  Her lectures are elegantly presented but the assignments could appear confusing at times.

She made what could have been my dullest course of the semester, Hst 300 approaches to History, into my favourite! She is a great facilitator and encourages class participation. She really shows that she cares about her students. I would take another course with her in a heart beat!

If she likes you, she will give you a good grade. The ones that pucker up the professor. She is clear and concise during lectures, however, during midterms she may ask you one detail she only went over once in class once. The textbook was almost of no use when it came to the tests (gives you broad info.). Horrible professor underneath a good smile

I love Roxanne! She was interesting, energetic and helpful. She was knowledgeable and very approachable. I found the focus on social implications very helpful because military history can be very dry! If you are looking for a prof that will be a guiding factor in your academic future, get to know Roxanne! I will look for future classes of hers!

Roxanne is a fantastic prof. Can't say enough good things about her. She is helpful, energetic, interesting and interested in her students. She puts a lot in and in turn expects a lot from her students. If you put the effort in, you'll do well. As I read in someone else's posting, if you're there for an easy A you should drop out of school.
Really nice prof. and easy course to take, but her marking is kinda weird. Take her course if you think you  got perfect english. However, her lecture is fun and relaxing.

Fun and Easy going Prof, encourages questions and comments. Tutorials are informative and entertaining. Some of the Tutorials have lame-esque group exercises, but still no problem. I like how she handles Essay's, great topics with choice I Recommend her for sure. I'm gonna take her HIST 235 class this summer.

You don't suppose professors actually look at these entries do you?  I suppose they do.  Roxanne is splendid.  An excellent balance of all things I value in a professor.  If you're reviewing this to determine if she will give you an easy mark, she won't; and you should drop out of school.

While the material was presented in a very engaging and energetic fashion, some of her requirements for the essays/assignments were confusing and at times, contradictory. Up until the final exam, I still wasn't sure what she was looking for. She's a good professor, but I would show hesitation when enrolling in another class with her.

This is a great class if you're taking a third year class for the first time.  she really preps you for the final research papers and is really nice and helpful.  Participation is greatly expected and there is a lot of reading (as is with every hist class);  Also is a writing intensive class.  I would recommend.
No Comments
Great prof, very friendly and helpful. lectures are a little disorganized, but that's ok. She's always willing to help; she wants students to come see her. She's pretty cute too!
No Comments
One of the best I've encountered. Engaging, inspired, caring and helpful. She's a sunny day amidst all the gloom.

Roxanne is the****! ANY class with her is worth taking. She will totally alter the way you read, think, and do history. She is tough but always willing to spend countless hours helping you in person or via email. Super flexible and understanding. Best prof EVER! Why can't more profs be as interesting and engaging?
Extremely nice prof, witty, enjoyed the class lectures immensely, & the self-deprecating humour. But be prepared to work, lots of reading & assignments. Would recommend.

I enjoyed her class very much. Active participation in daily discussion is key.  Lots of reading and a few movies but overall a very interesting course.  I would definitely take her class again.  Two essays in which your overall grade depends heavily on 25% and 50% but no final.

A very intensive workload, which is doable if one keeps up with the work. The marking was not, overall, too bad, but it was done in a picky manner. She does appear willing to help students out if they need it. However, her downside is the disorganiztion associated with the lectures.

She's great - always ready to help. I do agree it's sometimes hard to understand what the hell she wants on an assignment, but she's smart, passionate about her subject and genuinely interested in her students.

She is a great prof, passionate about what she teaches. She is very clear about what she wants, and her lectures are fantastic. Take her if you really wanna learn something about the French nation. There were too many essays...4 total and weekly responses...but overall a very good class.
No Comments
No Comments

Roxanne is the best.Tough assignments & hard marker but always willing to help.Refreshing teaching sytle in her perspective, assignments, & material.Strongly recommend taking any course she teaches.Makes you work but you will be better student because of it.Genuinely cares about students' progress.

WICKED LADY.  So easy to talk with.  Very passionate about her career.  Hard marker, but fair.  Different style of lectures, but if you're more of a go to class and "put off" the text books kind of person then this class is totally for you.  Great style.

Interesting class but prof has a tendency to lose it if someone says something she disagrees with. Be warned that she is a very very hard marker. But once  in a while she bends over and makes it all worthwhile.
Such a sweetheart.

I liked her, but wish her readings had been a bit more interesting. Tough marker as well. She runs a terrific tutorial though, I'll say that for her. Genuinely interested in her subject and her students, which is nice.
Unusual teaching style: didn't so much lecture as converse with the class. Still, really nice prof, lots of energy. Like most history profs, really passionate about her discipline.
This woman is pure gold!  The class itself isn't but Panchasi will take care of you so you can survive.

She's okay, I guess. But I was really excited about this class and it didn't live up to my expectations. Boring, obscure assignments. Some really awful readings. Unreasonable (and partial)marker. But good tutorial discussions, and she's nice.
waste of time and money
Awesome prof...fair class. Tutorial discussions fantastic, assignments pesky. Worth it in the end.  No exams. Recommend any class taught by Roxanne.
Wonderful prof! Very interesting, helpful and also quite inspiring!
SHE IS A TOUGH MARKER.. She screamed at so many of my peers in my class.. giving them a piece of her mind about their lack of quality... But she's sorta hot.. =D Nice person too!
great class, great prof
The most intellectual comment I can produce is w00t
I thoroughly appreciated Roxanne's effort to introduce the class to the more obscure and ambiguous issues in French history.  A well-organized and engaging speaker with excellent fashion sense.

History majors listen up! Incredibly refreshing approach to history. Very, very fair marker; you have ample time to master subject matter before writing on it, plus she will be glad to help. Subject matter is actually interesting as well. Totally cute too
A great professor, more than that a great person

This was a writting intensive course and as a result there was no exams but 3 essays and a written piece everyweek. Very helpful and makes class interesting. Not a regergitation course for a change! from a 3.77 student
No Comments
really nice teacher.  NO EXAMS,but a lot of written work which is not too hard.  really clear and fun lectures.  would highly recommend.
really good teacher, no exams, mostly papers and really interesting class. would recommend this class to anyone. By the way, she is HOT!
No Comments
Approachable, good lecturer, places herself at an equal level with students.  Do not take her courses unless you're pretty good with attendance, she doesn't appreciate people who don't show up.
Class was always interesting and went by quick.  Fair marker.  She was fun and made students feel like she was on the same level as them.  Really cool teacher.
Roxanne is awesome! For me personally, however, he teaching style is a little progressive, and needs to be a bit more grounded in the material.
A great prof and a great person
Great prof; friendly, approachable, fair, interesting lectures
Teach me history, don't make me read a novel. Thanks.
She's the best :)
Awesome prof!
No Comments
No Comments
awesome class discussions, fantastic/challenging readings
the most fantastic prof I've ever had in greece
Hated the class, but prof was nice and lectures were interesting
Excellent prof. Great to talk to outside of lecture too.
